org.opendaylight.protocol.framework

Interface SessionListener<M,S extends ProtocolSession<?>,T extends TerminationReason>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    NetconfClientSessionListener, NetconfSessionListener<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetconfDeviceCommunicator, NetconfServerSessionListener, SimpleNetconfClientSessionListener, SimpleSessionListener

    public interface SessionListener<M,S extends ProtocolSession<?>,T extends TerminationReason>
extends java.util.EventListener
    Listener that receives session state information. This interface should be implemented by a protocol specific abstract class, that is extended by a final class that implements the methods.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onMessage(S session, M message)
      Fired when a normal protocol message is received.
      void onSessionDown(S session, java.lang.Exception e)
      Fired when the session went down because of an IO error.
      void onSessionTerminated(S session, T reason)
      Fired when the session is terminated locally.
      void onSessionUp(S session)
      Fired when the session was established successfully.

    • Method Detail

      • onSessionUp

        void onSessionUp(S session)
        Fired when the session was established successfully.
        Parameters:
        remoteParams - Peer address families which we accepted

      • onSessionDown

        void onSessionDown(S session,
                 java.lang.Exception e)
        Fired when the session went down because of an IO error. Implementation should take care of closing underlying session.
        Parameters:
        session - that went down
        e - Exception that was thrown as the cause of session being down

      • onSessionTerminated

        void onSessionTerminated(S session,
                       T reason)
        Fired when the session is terminated locally. The session has already been closed and transitioned to IDLE state. Any outstanding queued messages were not sent. The user should not attempt to make any use of the session.
        Parameters:
        reason - the cause why the session went down

      • onMessage

        void onMessage(S session,
             M message)
        Fired when a normal protocol message is received.
        Parameters:
        message - Protocol message
